intro: Pteropepon monospermus var. stipitatus, commonly known as the stipitate pteropepon, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its unique morphological features, including the presence of stipules that are distinctly enlarged and stipitate, giving it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, a trait common in many cucurbit species. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its ecological role in seed dispersal.
